author: sky.cactus
content:
<@!425279588009246720> Re: <https://notes.ethereum.org/@axic/Hyrc1i7ED#Ether-transfer>
I strongly believe the gas stipend is terrible and we should definitely not be limiting gas in this example.  Not being able to send ETH to contracts should be the hard path, and being able to send ETH to contracts (with a payable function) should be the easy path.

author: sky.cactus
content: I also would advocate for `CREATE2` for contract creation only, there has been a very weak desire to stop using CREATE as the nonce bumping it does is a bit annoying for some proposals, so the more we can move away from it the easier some kind of future deprecation will be.

author: sky.cactus
content: Looks like you have a CREATE2 example, I would just recommend dropping the contract creation one (other than as an illustrative example, but not as something that we make available to users in any kind of final list).
